message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
// Create a map to store the column headers and their corresponding values
Map<String, List<String>> columnsMap = new HashMap<>();

// Split the input string by comma and space
String[] columnsArray = inputString.split(", ");

// Iterate over the columnsArray
for (String column : columnsArray) {
    // Split each column by '=' to separate the header and value
    String[] columnParts = column.split("=");

    // Get the header and value
    String header = columnParts[0];
    String value = columnParts[1];

    // Check if the header already exists in the map
    if (columnsMap.containsKey(header)) {
        // If it exists, add the value to the existing list
        columnsMap.get(header).add(value);
    } else {
        // If it doesn't exist, create a new list and add the value
        List<String> valuesList = new ArrayList<>();
        valuesList.add(value);
        columnsMap.put(header, valuesList);
    }
}

// Print the column headers
for (String header : columnsMap.keySet()) {
    System.out.print(header + "\t");
}
System.out.println();

// Print the values for each column
int numRows = columnsMap.values().stream().mapToInt(List::size).max().orElse(0);
for (int i = 0; i < numRows; i++) {
    for (List<String> valuesList : columnsMap.values()) {
        if (i < valuesList.size()) {
            System.out.print(valuesList.get(i) + "\t");
        } else {
            System.out.print("\t");
        }
    }
    System.out.println();
}
  
<<<explanation>>>: 
1. Split the input string by comma and space to get an array of columns.
2. Iterate over each column and split it by '=' to separate the header and value.
3. Check if the header already exists in the map. If it does, add the value to the existing list. If it doesn't, create a new list and add the value.
4. Print the column headers.
5. Print the values for each column, making sure to handle cases where a column may have fewer values than others.
